result.execSummary:
The defendant Juan A Velazquez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Repeater], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Repeater], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Pay court costs.   **NOTE: THE DEFENDANT IS ORDERED TO PAY ALL COURT OBLIGATIONS TO THE CLERK OF COURTS OFFICE.   Payment is due within 30 days.  If the Defendant cannot make the payment, he/she must report to the Clerk of Courts Office to set up a payment plan.  Failure to comply will result in other collection methods including a civil Judgment and/or suspension of your drivers license for two (2) years.  This judgment may be collected by income assignment if you fail to pay fines and costs as ordered.
-------------------------

No alcohol. Any prescription medications to be made known to Agent and taken as prescribed.   Not to operate a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license. No contact with victims Connisa Holst, Henry Holst, Brandon Drews, K.J.H.D dob 01/06/2013 and Christopher Osinski.
-------------------------

Counseling as recommended by Probation Agent.   Provide biological specimen to state crime lab for DNA analysis, and pay DNA analysis surcharge.   The defendant must pay Department of Corrections Supervision fees.
-------------------------

Defense Sentencing Memo
Temporary Commitment form filed
Defendant Juan A Velazquez in court, in custody with attorney Jason Sanders.  Haley Jo Johnson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minutes filed.
BOND QUASHED

Defendant Juan A Velazquez in court, in custody with attorney Jason Sanders.  Matthew W. Surridge appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Bond remains.  Minutes filed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 2, 2016 at 10:00 am.
For Substitution of Attorneys
Atty Jason Sanders

4:04 pm  Court in session.  
Haley Jo Johnson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant Juan A Velazquez in court, in custody with attorney David A Danz.  
Interpreter Vicki Bermudez is present.  
Discussion between Court and Attys as to whether the Deft requires in an interpreter.  
He has appeared in Court both with an interpreter and without an interpreter.  
Deft indicates he does not need an interpreter.  Interpreter Bermudez is excused.  
Victims wanted to be present today but could not because of scheduling conflicts.  
Atty Johnson has provided a written stmt on behalf of the victim to the Court and Atty Danz.  
4:08 pm  Parties have a joint agreement.  Atty Danz makes a record as to the agreement reached by the parties. 
Attys reference another file of the Deft's which the Court does not have 2015CM000130.  
The Deft plead to the charges in that file and an independent PSI was prepared and filed with the Court.
CCAP shows an incorrect sentencing date of April 8th at 4:00 p.m. for that file.  Short break is taken to obtain that file.
4:13 pm  Discussion between Court and the Attys and the Deft with regard to the agreement and deft's understanding of the potential consequences of his plea.  
Deft responds to questions of both Atty Johnson and Atty Danz relating to deportation as a potential consequence.  
Atty Danz indicates that based on his colloquy with the deft, he should withdraw as his Atty and an immigration Atty should be consulted.
4:29 pm  Atty Johnson expresses concerns with proceeding with plea and sentencing hearing.  
4:30 pm  Atty Danz proposes not proceeding today and he will contact the State Public Defender's office.  
4:33 pm  Court in recess.  
Status conference scheduled for March 22, 2016 at 08:30 am.
**Court believes an Interpreter is needed for the Defendant as he is difficult to understand when he speaks. 

NOTE:  FILE 2015CM000130 was not in Court at the time the case was called.  The court date was entered in CCAP for April 8th at 4:00 p.m. rather than March 8th at 4:00 p.m.  A break was taken during these proceedings so file 2015CM000130 could be pulled and brought to the courtroom.

Court in session 11:00am 

In court on 2 files 15CM130 and 15CM595. Defendant Juan A Velazquez in court, in custody with attorney David A Danz.   Haley J Johnson in court for State of Wisconsin.  
Statement by Atty Danz.  Request for continuance and would like to combine matters and to be heard with Judge Carlson.  
Statement by ADA Johnson and does not join in the request for the continuance.  
Atty Danz requests substitution of Judge Koss.
Plea and Sentencing scheduled for Tuesday, March 8 @ 4:00pm

Court adjourned 11:07am
